ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got a more advanced insight into how to use my voice properly and I got a lot stronger in terms of classical singing style
Improved my skill as a singer through exposure to and practice of classical music.
Vocal anatomy and technique!
This semester, I learned more solo pieces and many techniques to help my practice.
greatly improved my playing + musicality!!
I grew so much as a musician and human being under Professor Yuso grateful for the opportunity to study with her!

- improved technical and musical abilities on the clarinet 
- increased stamina, and increased performance experience through a studio recital
Cello improvement
I learned new percussion techniques and rehearsed a couple different pieces throughout the semester.
I developed a lot as a singer, specifically a classical singer. I gained many new singing techniques.
proper vocal technique
I expanded my repertoire and gained insight into improving my technique and phrasing.
I was very excited to continue working with Professor Sharp. This year I really felt that my bow arm technique improved.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It teaches you how to sing with very classical techniques which can apply to all types of singing but I wish there was more focus on genres that students were individually interested in
It would have been nice to study with, or at least have some more interaction with on a studio level, the YSM professor, but I understand why that's generally not possible.
Scheduling was inconsistent, a lot of lessons were cancelled which meant a lot in the last few weeks. Also learning of songs was not spread out very well

strengths: 
- Lloyd was a fantastic teacher 

weakness: 
- I wish that the lessons for credit program would pay for more than 10 lessons as there are more than 10 weeks in the semester
It is flexible and really up to the student how much they want to learn, as the instruction is phenomenal.
Private lessons for credit at Yale are individualized maximally for each student in an ideal manner.
There are no weaknesses of this course, unless your private teacher is not a great teacher. I got along well with my private teacher, and we were able to make music together and enjoy our lessons.
na
Teacher dependent

(Organ) Strengths: Very flexible regarding practice time, scheduling lessons, and choosing repertoire. Faculty are very patient, understanding, and down-to-earth
Weaknesses: Access to organs around campus is pretty restrictive for secondary students
The weekly structure of these lessons allows you to really improve over the course of the year.

I think it is a strength that Professor Akahoshi is very understanding and responds to his student's own goals. I think it would be helpful if he gave more concrete help in actually setting the goals and kept me more accountable for making progress.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! I came in with no vocal experience whatsoever and feel like I have a good grasp of technique to the point where I dont feel inferior to other singers and performers who have studied voice for a long time
Yes!
Absolutely would recommend this course to any student who wishes to do the work to improve as a singer. This requires open-mindedness and humility on the part of the student!
Take lessons!
Yes, if you would like to maintain your solo skills.
absolutely lessons are awesome and so chill, the YSM students and profs who teach are just incredible
yes, if you want to take music lessons!
Yes definitely if they want to continue music.
For students who are looking to continue instrumental instruction, this course is a perfect fit.
If they want to get better at an instrument, I would.
Definitely! This course is a wonderful opportunity to extend training in the classroom and develop vital techniques for singing.
yes, especially if they have music experience

(for organ) Yes! My teacher, a grad student, was incredibly patient and flexible, provided great insight that helped me develop my phrasing/technique, found new pieces that I really enjoyed learning, and keeps me updated with gigs/performances happening around campus.
Yes! If you want to study an instrument seriously at Yale, lessons for credit are the way to go!
I would absolutely recommend this course to anyone who wants to further pursue their music studies.
Yes, I found this course extremely helpful in my personal growth as a musician.
